intro: Mananthes gracilis, commonly known as the slender mananthes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers are adapted to its wetland habitat. Mananthes gracilis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in wetland restoration projects.
